title: Conductors - E-field from induced surface charge

content.description: Also shown is a cylindrical Gaussian surface, which has its faces parallel to the disk faces. The surface is not drawn to scale, and the distance between the two end faces is small compared to the diameter of the cylinder. Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is at the center of the face of the Gaussian surface that is just inside the metal disk, and Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is at the center of the face of the Gaussian surface that is just outside the disk, on the opposite side of the positive particle.
content.question: A nonzero electric field exists at Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>. Which of the following is a correct explanation of why this field is nonzero?

choices.label: The Gaussian surface encloses a nonzero amount of charge, and there is zero electric flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.

The Gaussian surface encloses a nonzero amount of charge, and the electric flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> must equal the flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.

The Gaussian surface encloses zero net charge, and the electric flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is equal in magnitude and opposite in sign to the flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.
The Gaussian surface encloses zero net charge, and therefore the electric field around the positive particle is unaffected by the presence of the disk.

content.answer: The Gaussian surface encloses a nonzero amount of charge, and there is zero electric flux through the face containing Point <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>.
